thread.title: National Equity Fund Increases Its Strength In The Southern Region Of The U.S.
thread.title_full: National Equity Fund Increases Its Strength In The Southern Region Of The U.S. - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: National Equity Fund Increases Its Strength In The Southern Region Of The U.S.
text:
National Equity Fund
CHICAGO , Oct. 5, 2015 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- National Equity Fund, Inc. recently hired Jason Aldridge as vice president of originations. Aldridge is joining NEF's Central team and will be based in Dallas focusing on deals in the southern part of the country.
Most recently, Aldridge served as relationship manager with Wells Fargo Bank in Dallas where he was responsible for the origination, underwriting and closing of multi-family projects with a focus on Low Income Housing Tax Credit (LIHTC) properties in Texas , New Mexico , California , Mississippi and Colorado . Prior to that he was a developer associate with White Rock Commercial, LLC based in Dallas , an assistant project manager with St. Joe Company in Panama City Beach, Florida , and a project developer at AIG Baker in Birmingham, Alabama .
"We are thrilled to have Jason join the NEF team," commented Mike Jacobs , national leader of the originations group. "Jason's extensive background in finance and real estate as well as his local market knowledge will serve our clients well in addition to strengthening our commitment to quality affordable housing in the southern portion of the country."
Aldridge holds a BA in finance and economics from Loyola University New Orleans and a masters in real estate and finance from the University of Georgia .
About National Equity Fund, Inc.
National Equity Fund, Inc. is a leading syndicator of Low Income Housing Tax Credits. The Chicago -based non-profit is an affiliate of the Local Initiatives Support Corporation and has played an integral role in creating affordable housing options, revitalizing communities and strengthening local economies for more than 27 years. It has invested $11.4 billion in 2,300 LIHTC developments, creating approximately 140,000 affordable homes for low-income families and individuals. For more information, visit www.nefinc.org/
Contact: Maureen Mullady
312.697.6460
mmullady@nefinc.org
